PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to secure a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If you have any questions or remarks, or desire particular events, it may help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1922, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

If less than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should answer the questions.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) Pioneer health conditions
( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
( ) Pioneer housing
( ) Pioneer education and upbringing
( ) Pioneer farming experience

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences or those of your family. It is not necessary for you to answer all questions; only those which apply to your experience should be answered.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1871, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled Pioneer Fiat: What Will Western Canadian Pioneers Say? is still being circulated. If you have not already received a copy, please send a stamped addressed envelope to the Provincial Archivist, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Instructions for Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent records of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:
